Articles.Content:
Planning my first foray to Jool and man it looks expensive. It's essentially a Jool-4 mission with a 10-ton lander that drops down to 4 ton for the smaller moons. My mothership should have about 5500 dv on arrival to the system and after checking tools like http://13375.de/KSPDeltaVMap/, it looks like it's going to come up short. Transfers between the moons average 1000dv, then there's orbit capture burns, then it's another 2500-3000 to transfer back to Kerbin. Am I reading this wrong? 

Edited June 1, 2016 by Lunar Sea

2 hours ago, Lunar Sea said:

Planning my first foray to Jool and man it looks expensive. It's essentially a Jool-4 mission with a 10-ton lander that drops down to 4 ton for the smaller moons. My mothership should have about 5500 dv on arrival to the system and after checking tools like http://13375.de/KSPDeltaVMap/, it looks like it's going to come up short. Transfers between the moons average 1000dv, then there's orbit capture burns, then it's another 2500-3000 to transfer back to Kerbin. Am I reading this wrong? 

It does take quite a bit of fuel to visit all the moons of Jool. However, the tool you're using seems to be extremely inaccurate. It substantially overstates the delta-V required for most of the transfers.

I prefer a tool such as: https://alexmoon.github.io/ksp/

However, even that tool doesn't allow you to plan a direct transfer from one of the moons to Kerbin. For example, a direct Laythe->Kerbin transfer is around 1300 m/s, much less than what many delta-V maps would seem to suggest.

Don't forget that you can save quite a bit by using gravity assists to move around the Jool system. A reverse gravity assist from Laythe or Tylo can easily place you in a nice elliptical orbit that lets you get Low Jool science while letting you visit any of the inner moons with relative ease.
Cool, that is definitely encouraging. I'm hoping 5500 dv is sufficient, and since the lander weight is substantially lessened after Laythe hopefully that should help.

Here is the Jool delta-V map I use for Jool subsystem interplanetary transfers.

Edited June 2, 2016 by Warzouz
